discourse_list.title: Query on DAI bridged from Ethereum to BSC

content.content: Hi, I’m doing some stats on bridged stablecoins and I haven’t been able to figure this out, I searched but was not able to find the info so I apologize if there is a simple answer somewhere. There are 262M DAI circulating on BSC from the Binance-Peg Dai Token contract. There is 192M DAI in the Binance: Binance-Peg Tokens bridge contract on Ethereum. I’m trying to find out where the remaining 70M DAI is held that has been bridged to BSC. Thanks for any info. I also have another (less important) question: On Cronos, there is 161M DAI circulating. This has not been bridged from anywhere. Is it really DAI?
I think for those, it might be held in CeFi like Binance exchange itself and Crypto.com wallets.

Ok, thanks. I think you might be correct for BSC, because the Binance wallets are not well labelled, and if the 70M were spread across 3 or 4 of them it makes sense. I recently noticed the same thing happening with TUSD. For the Crypto.com one, there is no way a wallet, or even 3-4 wallets could hold 161M DAI without being conspicuous on the Top DAI Holders list on Etherscan. So will continue searching for that answer.
This topic was automatically closed 91 days after the last reply. New replies are no longer allowed.
